Others: Since MLB introduced the 'ghost runner' rule in 2020, the Houston Astros have had a losing record in extra-innings games in four of five seasons.
They were 2-7 in 2020, 9-8 in 2021, 5-6 in 2022, 1-8 last year, and 5-10 this season.
That's a combined record of 21-33, which translates to a horrendous.388 winning percentage.
In all other games during that span, Houston is 397-293 -- a.575 winning percentage.
Since the beginning of last year, the Astros are just 6-18 in extras following their latest debacle against the Oakland Athletics on Tuesday.
